
Intercepted: a short message encrypted with RSA. Rumor says the modulus is a Blum integer—can you exploit this to recover the original message from 1600369688852760600046953869195022282998559029801577491438231626202477379310505009686738258616635742316209841023827312930015671642249804979510103574397443?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=9977642835985694213286379451373239777889972817551024897678665057244267082312683480103368728459676101675513500376325968599725393466630181399029859933987777, e=8151557142677167301141619750707298479979729307393334448285227201381788557050143897046707297520543723351323745415917634226026360636342190445778754159145669
The lower 104 bits of p are: 39054426840971401887691224623845588495

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{92yu6u7p}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1600369688852760600046953869195022282998559029801577491438231626202477379310505009686738258616635742316209841023827312930015671642249804979510103574397443
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9977642835985694213286379451373239777889972817551024897678665057244267082312683480103368728459676101675513500376325968599725393466630181399029859933987777, e=8151557142677167301141619750707298479979729307393334448285227201381788557050143897046707297520543723351323745415917634226026360636342190445778754159145669
The lower 104 bits of p are: 39054426840971401887691224623845588495

extra_info: p=91007561670055180994219626589449597489262732470238277890693105900071047511567, q=109635316592255255700174340062566760372922663615689522867223460940316317667631, φ(n)=9977642835985694213286379451373239777889972817551024897678665057244267082312482837225106418022981707708861484018463783203639465665872264832189472568808580
